We have both of our limelight’s connected to our switch, but when we use our limelight finder tool we only see the IP of one of the limelight’s. Does anyone have any ideas on how to fix this? Both limelight’s are on and their Ethernet ports are class=\"inline-onebox\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ePortForwarder (WPILib API 2023.2.1)\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e(Thank you whoever made this allowing me to skip over complicated IP tables Crosby Jr","username":"NewtonCrosbyJr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/newtoncrosbyjr/{size}/163897_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-26T13:35:38.252Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eYou’ll have to configure each one separately, and you’ll need the networking equipment to support each camera’s ethernet. There are tons of little 3 or 4 port switches that are pretty cheap to get, so I’d recommend looking for those. As far as each camera, you’ll need to give each one it’s own address and hostname. Set one up under 10.TE.AM.whatever, and give it a unique hostname (such as that camera’s function. I had two cameras on my robot last year, so one was hosted as \u003ccode\u003edrivecam\u003c/code\u003e, and the other was hosted as \u003ccode\u003etargetingpod\u003c/code\u003e ) that will 100% not collide with something else. As long as each camera is unique (i.e. the second would be 10.TE.AM.[first camera’s ip+1]), you should be fine. Each one will have a unique networktables entry and you’ll be able to treat each one independently. Just make sure your software guys accommodate this in code, because each camera will need to be it’s own Object in software, otherwise it won’t work.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-01-26T13:35:38.252Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":117.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":424632,"topic_slug":"configuring-multiple-limelights","display_username":"Newton Crosby Jr","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51042,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Now availible on DVD and Blu-Ray!"},"post_url":"/t/configuring-multiple-limelights/424632/5","custom_user_title":"Now availible on DVD and Blu-Ray!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3295048,"name":"system","username":"system","avatar_template":"/uploads/default/original/4X/9/3/2/93234578e69f55873c63fc00fe2d0d85f23bce55.png","created_at":"2024-01-26T13:35:50.468Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThis topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply.
